business.headline: Dreaming of a job abroad? These are the easiest countries to get a work visaLatvia is the easiest country to get a skilled worker visa. It scored 7.64 out of 10 for ease of entry. The visa itself costs around 83 pounds and typically gets approved in ten working days, according to a study conducted by Remitly.
Explained: Why did Protean shares crash 20% todayProtean eGov Technologies, earlier known as NSDL e-Governance Infrastructure, provides technology solutions for various citizen-focused services.

India ousts Turkey's Celebi: $200 million lost in market-cap, jobs on the lineThe company, listed on the Istanbul Stock Exchange, saw its shares drop 20% in just two trading sessions. On 16 May, the stock fell 222 points to close at 2,002 lira.
Sensex opens 50 points lower, Nifty above 25,000; IT stocks down in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 36.40 points to 82,366.99, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 5.65 points to 25,014.15 as of 9:26 am.
Sensex, Nifty today: Key levels and sectors to watch. Here's how to tradeMarket experts say there is still positive momentum in the market, but traders should be cautious and focus on key levels.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty to open flat. Here's whyThe Nifty50 index gained 4.2%, and foreign investors bought shares worth Rs 15,925 l . Thast week. This was the fifth week in a row of buying by foreign portfolio investors.

Stocks to watch on May 19: Bajaj Auto, Delhivery, Dr Reddy's, JSW Steel, BELMany companies will be in focus due to their earnings and key updates, such as Power Grid Corporation of India, Bharat Electronics, DLF, ACME Solar Holdings, Bajaj Auto, Delhivery, Dr Reddy's, JSW Steel, etc.

Bengal to be impacted by Bangladesh import curbs, but nation first: OfficialsThe central government on Saturday imposed port restrictions on the import of a few Bangladeshi goods, such as readymade garments and processed food items.

India restricts Bangladesh imports through northeast check postsA wide range of Bangladeshi products will be restricted via the Integrated Check Posts in the northeastern states of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram.

India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement: Final Phase Negotiations Aim For ConclusionUnion Minister Piyush Goyal will lead a team to the United States for trade talks. India and the US are working to finalize the Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) by early July. The US President has proposed a trade agreement with India that would have no tariffs on a wide range of American products. The US President stated, 'India is one of the highest tariff nations in the world. It's very hard to sell into India.'

Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Why the middle class is chasing expensive brands, explains market expertA market expert noted that nearly 75% of luxury spending today comes from the middle class, not due to rising incomes, but because of social media, marketing tricks, and peer pressure that fuel the urge to appear successful.

Indian traders' body boycotts Turkey and Azerbaijan over support for PakistanThe move comes after both Turkey and Azerbaijan openly showed support for Pakistan, at a time when India is facing sensitive national security challenges.

India-US trade deal: First phase likely to be ready by July 1, say sourcesIndia and the United States are in negotiations for a trade deal, with sources indicating that phase one could be ready by July 1st.

India to grow at 6.3%, ahead of China, US, and European Union: UN reportAccording to the UN's mid-year update of the World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP), India's growth is being fuelled by strong household spending and solid government investments.

Sensex slips 200 points, Nifty holds ground above 25,000; defence stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 200.15 points to close at 82,330.59, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.30 points to end at 25,019.80.

2 IPOs to open next week: Check Belrise Industries, Borana Weaves detailsWhile Belrise Industries will open for bidding on May 21, investors can bid for the IPO of Borana Weaves starting May 20, 2025.

ITR filing 2025: Is July 31 your tax deadline? Find outFiling your return on time helps avoid penalties and delays in refunds. It also keeps your financial records in order. So, if your deadline is July 31, skip the last-minute rush and file in advance.

ITR filing 2025: Is digital Form 16 a game-changer for salaried taxpayers?Digital Form 16 is an electronic version of the traditional Form 16. It's generated directly from the TRACES portal, which is managed by the Income Tax Department. This means all your salary details, TDS, and tax-saving deductions are recorded accurately and match what the government sees.

Government clears 187 startups for tax relief. Here's what it meansTo qualify, the start-up must be recognised by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). It should be a private limited company or a limited liability partnership and its turnover should not cross Rs 100 crore in any year since incorporation.

What Pakistan can and can't do with IMF loanThe International Monetary Fund (IMF) has approved a fresh loan package for Pakistan, agreeing to release USD 1 billion under its Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

Defence stocks extend rally on possible budget boost. What should investors do?The NSE Nifty India Defence index surged over 5% intraday on Friday. Cochin Shipyard and GRSE have been leading the charge, with the latter gaining a stunning 30% since May 13.

Singtel offloads 1.2% stake in Bharti Airtel in $1.54 billion dealSingtel, which has been an investor in Airtel for over 20 years, said its stake would drop to 28.3%, valued at around S$48 billion, from 29.5% previously.

Blaming NRIs won't solve India's housing problem, says investor. Here's whyNRIs earn in strong currencies like US dollars, pounds, or euros. So when they convert that money to rupees, they can afford much more. A house that seems expensive to someone in India may feel quite reasonable to someone earning abroad.

Cochin Shipyard, GRSE rally up to 12%: Why are these defence stocks rising?Cochin Shipyard jumped 12.51% to Rs 2,039 on the BSE at around 11:47 am, extending its rally for a sixth straight session. GRSE climbed 11.10% intraday to Rs 2,510, taking its cumulative gains to over 30% since announcing results post-market on May 13.

Stop all bookings to America, warns ace investor as Indians ditch TurkeyTourism to Turkey and Azerbaijan has already taken a major hit, especially after reports that Pakistan used Turkish-made drones in its recent strikes.

Borana Weaves IPO to open May 20: Check GMP, expected listing gainsAccording to grey market trends, the IPO is commanding a premium of Rs 55 per share, suggesting potential listing gains of over 25% for successful applicants.

Apple assures India manufacturing plans intact despite Trump remarks: ReportWhile Apple has not issued a public statement, sources said the company reaffirmed to Indian officials that India remains a key part of its global supply chain.

Explained: Why Yes Bank shares are in focus todayYes Bank stock: The shares fell over 1% in early trade but later recovered to trade in the green. At the start of the day, Yes Bank shares opened at Rs 21.50, slightly below Thursday's close of Rs 21.51.

Pakistan offers zero-tariff bilateral trade deal to US: ReportThe development comes shortly after US President Donald Trump claimed credit for brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, following four days of intense cross-border hostilities involving drones and missile strikes.
Explained: Why Bharti Airtel shares fell 3% in early trade today At 9:35 am, shares of Bharti Airtel were trading 2.69% lower at Rs 1,816.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

IndusInd bank shares down 2% after private lender flags interest mistakeIndusInd bank stock opened at Rs 735.95 after having closed at Rs 780.30 in the previous session. The shares have lost 7.29% in the past 5 days, 23.55% over the last 6 months, and 45.48% over the past year.
Sensex, Nifty open lower after yesterday's rally; IndusInd Bank down 3%The BSE Sensex was down 226.18 points to 82,304.56 at 9:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 67.80 points to trade at 24,994.30.

Stock market today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyBoth the Sensex and Nifty touched their highest levels in the last seven months in the last session. So far this week, the Nifty has gained around 4.5% and the BSE Sensex about 4%.
Stocks to watch on May 16: Hyundai, Airtel, IndusInd Bank, BHEL, Bajaj AutoHyundai Motor, BHEL, Delhivery, Emami will announce their earnings for the January-March quarter on Friday.

IndusInd Bank flags Rs 674 crore error as 'incorrectly recorded interest'The bank said its Internal Audit Department (IAD) found that a total of Rs 674 crore was wrongly shown as interest over three quarters in FY 2024-25.
India offered zero-tariff trade deal: Donald TrumpUS President Donald Trump claimed that India has offered the United States a trade deal with "literally zero tariffs".

YES Bank shares jump 21% in 5 days. What investors need to knowSMBC, a part of the Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (SMFG), plans to buy the 20% stake from State Bank of India (SBI) and seven private banks, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Axis Bank, IDFC First Bank, Federal Bank, and Bandhan Bank.

Sensex ends 1,200 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Tata Motors surges 4%The S&P BSE Sensex surged 1,200.18 points to end at 82,530.74, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 395.60 points to close at 25,062.10.

Donald Trump claims India has offered zero-tariff deal in trade talksSpeaking at a business forum in Qatar, Trump said, "India has offered us a deal where basically they are willing to literally charge us no tariff." He didn't provide further details, and there was no immediate response from the Indian government.

entertainment.headline: Tom Cruise eyes Top Gun, Days of Thunder sequels: Thinking many different storiesActor Tom Cruise hinted at potential sequels to 'Top Gun: Maverick' and 'Days of Thunder' sequels. In an interview for the film, he said he is currently discussing 'many different stories'.

Guns N' Roses set Mumbai ablaze with a nostalgic, no-holds-barred rock spectacleAfter a 13-year hiatus, Guns N' Roses delivered a powerful and memorable concert in Mumbai, winning hearts with their classic hits. The band's energetic performance and crowd interaction made it a night to remember for fans.

Americans have no idea about Kashmir, India-Pakistan conflict: Vivek AgnihotriFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, in an exclusive interview with India Today, spoke about the West's perception of the India-Pakistan conflict, and the Kashmir issue. He said we need to make more films about the Valley the way the US made on the Holocaust.

Ananya Panday makes it to Forbes 30 list, rumoured partner Walker Blanco reactsAnanya Panday has been named in the Forbes' 30 Under 30 Asia list for 2025. Her rumoured partner, Walker Blanco, celebrated the achievement with a supportive note on Instagram Story.

Neil Nitin Mukesh on daughter Nurvi's love for arts and Big B's filmsActor Neil Nitin Mukesh reveals his six-year-old daughter Nurvi's growing passion for the arts and admiration for Amitabh Bachchan.

Rapper Vedan's Kerala concert ends early due to crowd mismanagementKerala rapper Vedan's concert in Palakkad faced chaos due to overwhelming crowd turnout. Police intervened with lathi charge but confirmed no major injuries at the venue.
Abhay Deol turns DJ at Gurugram nightclub, fans call him 'lord Bobby's student'Actor Abhay Deol took over the DJ console at a nightclub in Gurugram. A video of his set has gone viral.

Will get fitting reply: Ravi Kishan's warning to Pak against 'terrorist activity'Actor and BJP MP Ravi Kishan talked about India's Operation Sindoor against Pakistan-backed terrorism, and highlighted that we will give a 'fitting reply' to our neighbour if they 'provoke' us.

Rasha Thadani recreates mother Raveena's iconic Tip Tip Barsa Paani at event. WatchActor Rasha Thadani stole attention after she recreated her mother Raveena Tandon's iconic hit 'Tip Tip Barsa' from 'Mohra' at an award show. The video of her performance has gone viral.

New beginnings: Singer Keneeshaa's cryptic post amid actor Ravi Mohan's divorceSinger Keneeshaa shared a poetry about 'noise' and 'new beginnings' on her Instagram page. This post comes days after actor Ravi Mohan called her companion in four-page note against his ex-wife Aarti amid divorce battle.

Kyunki... fame Achint Kaur asks for work, says actor's life has peaks and pausesAchint Kaur, known for playing Mandira in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', posted a video asking for suitable work opportunities as an actor and voice-artiste. She also mentioned that her profession has its highs and lows.

Urvashi Rautela is bewitching in black at Cannes, but fans spot wardrobe glitchActor Urvashi Rautela's black outfit at Cannes drew attention after a viral video highlighted a small tear in her dress. Despite the mishap, she earned praise for her fashion choice.

Rashmika Mandanna asks fans to wait amid 'The Girlfriend' delay: Delivering soonActor Rashmika Mandanna and director Rahul Ravindran appealed to their fans to be patient amid 'The Girlfriend's' delay.  The actor promised that the updates would follow soon.

Mission Impossible 8 box office Day 2: Solid opening weekend, beats OppenheimerTom Cruise's 'Mission: Impossible-The Final Reckoning' is working fabulously at the box office in India. The film finished its first-weekend run on a strong note, also surpassing the two-day business of 'Oppenheimer'.

Suniel Shetty, Athiya praise KL Rahul after he smashes 5th century in IPLAthiya and her father-actor Suniel Shetty, praised KL Rahul after he smashed a century for at least three different franchises. This came after the Delhi Capitals game against the Gujarat Titans (GT) on May 18.

Resist ageism: Nicole Kidman's advice at Cannes as she champions gender equalityActor Nicole Kidman is 2025's recipient of Women in Motion Award at the Cannes Film Festival. Speaking at the event, she advocated for 'resisting ageism' in the world of cinema.

Nothing, just Ananya Panday recreating Main Tera Tota… with father ChunkyAnanya Panday and her father Chunky Pandey recreated the iconic song 'Main Tera Tota Tu Meri Maina' at a Saturday award function. Videos shared on Ananya's fan pages quickly won hearts online.

Tom Cruise shares glowing praise for rumoured girlfriend Ana de Armas' BallerinaHollywood star Tom Cruise was all praises for rumoured girlfriend Ana de Armas's film 'Ballerina'. He spoke about it during the London premiere of his film 'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning'.

Paresh Rawal confirms Hera Pheri 3 exit, says 'had no creative difference'Bollywood actor Paresh Rawal has announced his exit from the eagerly-awaited film Hera Pheri 3, clarifying that it is not due to creative differences. He expressed his respect and faith in the director Priyadarshan.

general news.headline: A Bajrang Bali war cry and payback: How Rajput Regiment soldiers destroyed Pak postsIndia Today spoke to the Indian Army bravehearts stationed along the International Border in Jammu, who swiftly and resolutely countered Pakistan's attacks, inflicting heavy casualties and destroying enemy posts.

Pakistan targeted Amritsar on May 8. How India's air defence saved Golden TemplePakistan engaged in an air assault with aerial weapons, including drones and long-range missiles, targeting the Golden Temple, which was "thwarted" by the army personnel, who remained prepared for such situations and attacks.

Pakistani 'spy' network busted in Haryana's Nuh, second arrest in 2 daysA Haryana man was arrested as the police busted a Pakistani spy network, marking the second arrest in two days in Haryana's Nuh, amid a spate of recent anti-espionage operations.

Was on leave: Ola Krutrim on Bengaluru techie's 'suicide' due to work pressureKrutrim, an artificial intelligence unit of Ola, came under fire after a social media post claimed that its employee died by suicide due to toxic work culture and pressure.
India Today at LoC: Unexploded Pak ammo recovered, destroyed on cameraThe Indian Army recovered and exploded Pakistani ammunition on camera. Gaurav Sawant from India Today was as the position.

ED arrests UCO Bank ex-chairman Subodh Goel in connection with Rs 6,210 fraud caseThe ED arrested former UCO Bank chairman Subodh Kumar Goel in a Rs 6210.72 crore bank fraud case linked to Concast Steel and Power Limited.
The world is full of idiots, @grok is this true?What does a world where people have outsourced their thinking to AI look like? It looks like the one where everyone is groking all the time.

Arrested YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra's Instagram suspended over alleged Pak linkTwo days after Haryana-based travel vlogger Jyoti Malhotra was arrested for allegedly sharing critical intel with Pakistani operatives and spying for them, her Instagram account has been blocked today.

Elon Musk reacts after his mother shares results of his 1989 computer aptitude testThe document, dated May 17, 1989, was issued by the University of Pretoria, where Elon Musk studied for a short period before moving to Canada at the age of 17.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Supreme Court orders equal pension for all retired High Court judgesThe Supreme Court has ruled that all retired High Court judges, whether permanent or additional, are entitled to full and equal pension and post-retirement benefits, affirming that any distinction violates Article 14 of the Constitution.

India won't play or host Asia Cup 2025 amid Pakistan tensions: SourcesIndia has decided not to play or host the Asia Cup this year amidst tensions with Pakistan, sources told India Today on Monday, May 19. The Women's Emerging Teams Asia Cup, which was slated to be held in June, has reportedly been cancelled.

Urvashi Rautela is bewitching in black at Cannes, but fans spot wardrobe glitchActor Urvashi Rautela's black outfit at Cannes drew attention after a viral video highlighted a small tear in her dress. Despite the mishap, she earned praise for her fashion choice.

Top court to hear plea of professor arrested over Op Sindoor post tomorrowAppearing on behalf of Ashoka University professor, Ali Khan Mahmudabad, senior advocate Kapil Sibal said that the professor was arrested for an 'entirely patriotic statement on Operation Sindoor.'

Joe Biden faces prostate cancer with Gleason score 9: What it meansFormer US President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer that has spread to his bones. The diagnosis highlights challenges in treatment, but offers hope through hormone therapy options.

Trinamool's Yusuf Pathan snubs government's Op Sindoor delegation inviteTrinamool Congress MP Yusuf Pathan has declined to join the Operation Sindoor foreign outreach delegation, after the government named him allegedly without consulting his party.

Decoding heart attack: The silent pandemic raging worldwideIn the post-Covid world, changing lifestyles, increased stress conditions, and poor environment are putting the heart under extreme pressure. We look at how the heart is at risk, and the world is eying a raging "silent pandemic."
Will resign if..: Himanta Sarma doubles down on Pak charge against Gaurav GogoiSarma claimed that Gogoi went to Pakistan at the invitation of Pakistan's spy agency Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI).

Heavy overnight rain floods parts of Bengaluru, traffic takes a hitBengaluru residents woke up to another wet Monday with roads waterlogged as rains lashed the city overnight. Several low-lying areas were flooded and many parts of the city saw waterlogging. With gridlocks across many parts of Karnataka's capital city.

Police foil bomb plot in Hyderabad, 2 ISIS-linked suspects arrestedPolice foiled an ISIS-linked bomb plot in Hyderabad, arresting two suspects, Siraj and Sameer, in a joint Telangana-Andhra operation.

Heist with twist: Ranchi thieves dance and feast while robbing sweets shopTwo unidentified thieves robbed a Ranchi sweet shop while dancing and feasting inside. The bizarre heist was caught on CCTV, showing them carefree and fearless.

Hyderabad blaze: Eyewitness recalls lifeless woman clutching dead childrenZahid, who runs a bangles business in nearby Gulzar House, quickly rushed to the spot with his friends to come to the family's aid. Instead, what they found upon breaking into the fire-engulfed house was a string of dead bodies -- the lifeless body of a woman clinging to the charred bodies of children.

After Operation Sindoor, India to give intel on Pak camps to anti-terror watchdogFollowing the success of Operation Sindoor and the subsequent exposure of Pakistan's denial of harbouring terrorists, India plans to submit fresh intelligence to the global terrorist financing watchdog, the Financial Action Task Force (FATF), regarding terrorist infrastructure operating within Pakistan.

India ousts Turkey's Celebi: $200 million lost in market-cap, jobs on the lineThe company, listed on the Istanbul Stock Exchange, saw its shares drop 20% in just two trading sessions. On 16 May, the stock fell 222 points to close at 2,002 lira.

sports.headline: Ben Stokes quits alcohol during injury rehab to stay fit for India seriesBen Stokes revealed he quit alcohol in January to speed up his recovery from a hamstring injury. With major series against India and Australia looming, the England captain made fitness his top priority during rehabilitation.

LSG vs SRH: Lucknow look to keep faint playoff hopes alive against HyderabadLucknow Super Giants aim to keep their faint play-off hopes alive against Sunrisers Hyderabad, who look to avoid the wooden spoon in IPL 2025. Both teams will miss a few key players in the contest at the Ekana stadium.

LSG focussed to win last 3 games and somehow sneak into playoffs: William O'RourkeLucknow Super Giants (LSG) are focussing on winning their last three league fixtures and qualifying for the play-offs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), revealed fast bowler William O'Rourke.

GT assistant coach backs Shubman Gill's captaincy with MS Dhoni referenceGT assistant coach Aashish Kapoor backed Shubman Gill's calm, strategic leadership during IPL 2025, drawing parallels with MS Dhoni as speculation grows around Gill becoming India's next Test captain.

IPL 2025: DC's Abishek Porel upbeat about playoff qualification despite GT lossDC's Abishek Porel is upbeat about the play-off qualification despite their loss to GT on Sunday. Delhi need to win their remaining two games to stand a chance of making it to the play-offs this season.

The Women's Emerging Teams Asia Cup, which was slated to be held in June, has reportedly been cancelled.

The duo added 205 runs for the opening partnership as Gujarat hammered Delhi by 10 wickets on Sunday to secure their spot in the playoffs.

Sinner jokes brother chose Formula 1 over watching his final vs AlcarazDespite losing the Italian Open final, Jannik Sinner kept spirits high with a cheeky remark about his brother missing the match for Formula 1, while Carlos Alcaraz claimed his first Rome title and continued his clay dominance.

One spot, three teams: Battle for IPL playoffs explainedPL 2025: Three teams - Gujarat, Punjab and Bengaluru - confirmed their spots in the playoffs on Sunday. With just one place up for grabs, three teams - Mumbai, Lucknow and Delhi - remain in the race

Captain Shubman Gill delighted to evolve as Gujarat Titans storm into playoffsShubman Gill said that he's delighted to evolve from his learning curve as captain, as Gujarat Titans qualified for the playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), following a comprehensive 10-wicket win over Delhi Capitals (DC).

Carlos Alcaraz spoils Sinner's Rome party, asserts Roland Garros favourite statusItalian Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz reaffirmed his status as the favourite to defend his French Open crown by hammering World No. 1 Jannik Sinner in straight sets in the final in Rome on Sunday. The defeat ended Sinner's unbeaten run in the 2025 season.

Shreyas Iyer becomes 1st captain to lead 3 different teams to IPL playoffsPunjab Kings have qualified for the IPL 2025 playoffs for the first time since 2014. Shreyas Iyer became the first captain to lead three different franchises into the IPL playoffs, marking a unique achievement.

Sai Sudharsan 108 trumps KL Rahul's 112 as GT storm into playoffsGujarat Titans secured a spot in the IPL 2025 playoffs after a commanding 10-wicket win against Delhi Capitals. Their strategic batting and top performances from Sudharsan and Shubman Gill highlighted the team's strong title ambitions this season.

DC vs GT: Kuldeep Yadav risks sanction after snapping at umpire over LBW callIPL 2025, DC vs GT: Kuldeep Yadav lost his cool after his LBW appeal against Sai Sudharsan was overturned. Gujarat Titans dominated the Capitals in a high-stakes match on Sunday.

1 Game, 3 Winners: Gujarat, Punjab, and Bengaluru qualify for IPL 2025 playoffsGujarat Titans took RCB and PBKS into playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with a comprehensive 10-wicket win over Delhi Capitals (DC).

Daring Max Verstappen beats McLarens to win Imola Grand PrixMax Verstappen secured a commanding victory at the Imola Grand Prix with a daring first lap overtake on Oscar Piastri. His win intensifies the Formula 1 title battle against the McLaren drivers.

Will take any opportunity with both hands: LSG's William O' RourkeWilliam O' Rourke is excited for any opportunity that may come his way in the remaining three matches of the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

KL Rahul hits 5th IPL hundred, goes past Shubman Gill in all-time listIPL 2025, DC vs GT: KL Rahul hit a 60-ball hundred for Delhi Capitals in their must-win game at home against Gujarat Titans. It was Rahul's fifth IPL hundred and his first since the 2022 season.

Harpreet Brar wins Player of Match award weeks after marriage, dedicates it to wifeIPL 2025, RR vs PBKS: Harpreet Brar dedicated his Player of the Match award to his wife, weeks after their marriage. The left-arm spinner took three wickets in Punjab's successful defence of 219 runs in Jaipur.

Injury scare for Shreyas Iyer? Punjab Kings captain gives updatePunjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer missed the second innings of their match vs Rajasthan Royals due to a finger injury sustained in practice. Iyer said that he did not know the nature of the injury and needed to get it checked.

KL Rahul reaches 8000 T20 runs faster than Virat Kohli but slower than Babar AzamIPL 2025: KL Rahul became the fastest Indian to score 8,000 runs in Twenty20 cricket, breaking Virat Kohli's record. The Delhi Capitals star is also the third-fastest overall to reach the milestone.

RR's chasing woes: Captain Samson unable to pin it down to a couple of reasonsSanju Samson said that he was unable to pin down RR's chasing woes to a couple of reasons after they lost to PBKS in Jaipur on Sunday, May 18. Rajasthan have just 6 points from 13 matches in IPL 2025.

DC vs GT: Kagiso Rabada makes comeback, Mustafizur Rahman replaces Starc in DelhiKagiso Rabada makes his comeback in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) after serving one month suspension for recreational drug use. On the other hand, Mustafizur Rahman is also set to play his first game of the season for Delhi Capitals.

Beautiful Barcelona deserved to win LaLiga: Real Madrid coach Carlo AncelottiCarlo Ancelotti praised Barcelona's beautiful football as they won the LaLiga title and domestic treble. He acknowledged injuries impacted Real Madrid's season and promised to prepare for his next challenge with Brazil.

RR vs PBKS: Punjab edge closer to playoffs after defending 219 in Jaipur thrillerPunjab Kings edged closer to the IPL 2025 playoffs with a 10-run win over Rajasthan Royals in Jaipur on Sunday, May 18. Nehal Wadhera's 70 and Harpreet Brar's three-wicket haul helped PBKS secure an important win.

RCB announce refund for washed out game vs KKR: Complete guide to get reimbursementRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have announced a ticket refund for their washed-out match against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. Here's a complete guide to get the reimbursement.

Travis Head down with Covid-19, SRH star's return: Coach VettoriTravis Head will miss SRH's upcoming IPL match against Lucknow due to a Covid-19-related delay. There is no clarity on when and here he contracted the virus.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
